drinks.name: Call Me 'Koko'
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Strain Over Fresh Ice
Garnish With Dehydrated Lemon & Basil Sprig

drinks.name: Give Me Park Avenue
instructions: Add rye whiskey, sweet vermouth, and bitters to a mixing glass filled with ice.
Stir until well chilled.
Strain into a  rocks glass with big cube.
Garnish with a cherry or orange twist.

drinks.name: Olive Your Dirty
instructions: In a mixing glass or Shaker, add gin ( or vodka ), dry vermouth and olive brine.
Fill with ice and stir ( for a smoother, clearer drink ) or shake ( for a cloudier, more aerated and chilled drink ).
Strain into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with olives.

drinks.name: Pink Horizon
instructions: Rim Glass (optional)
Fill Collins Glass with Ice.
Add Tequila & Lime Juice
Top with Grapefruit Soda
Garnish with Grapefruit Wedge or Lime Wheel

drinks.name: Spicy T & M
instructions: Add ice to rocks glass & pour .5 oz butterfly pea flower syrup
In Shaker the rest of the ingredients with ice & shake vigorously
Strain over fresh ice in rocks glass with butterfly pea flower syrup
Garnish with pineapple frond, dehydrated lime & jalapeno slice
batch: Combine ingredients in a sealed container.
Let sit for 72 hours depending on desired spice level.
Strain out jalapenos and store tequila for service.
alt. batch: Whisk & let stand for 10 minutes or until dark blue in color
Strain out flowers and let cool

drinks.name: Crouching Tiger
instructions: Build In Glass
Stir Lightly
Add Ice
Garnish With Flower

drinks.name: After Hours
instructions: Pour Ingredients Into Mixing Glass
Stir Until Properly Diluted
Strain Into Martini Glass
Garnish With Orange Peel

drinks.name: Beachy Lemonade
mixers: House Made Lemonade - Fill to Top
instructions: Build in glass
Garnish with dehydrated lemon & mint sprig
batch: Make Double or Triple Batch Depending on Popularity

drinks.name: Butterfly Effect
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Dry Shake
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Double Strain Over Big Rock
Let Settle
Float with Butterfly Pea / Honeysuckle Gin
Garnish With Flower

drinks.name: Dragon's Hive
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Double Strain Into Coupe Glass
Garnish With Dehydrated Lime & Flower

drinks.name: Empress Wu
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Double Strain Into Coupe Glass

drinks.name: Lotus Blossom
instructions: Pour Ingredients Into Mixing Glass
Stir Until Properly Diluted
Strain Into Martini Glass
Top With Plum Wine Foam & Dehydrated Plum

drinks.name: Midnight Hour
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Double Strain Into Coupe Glass

drinks.name: My Oh Mai Tai
liquor: My Oh Mai Tai Batch - 3 oz
instructions: Pour Into Cambro
Stir Until Thoroughly Mixed
Refridgerate for 24 Hours
Strain Through Coffee Filter into New Container

drinks.name: Open Sesame
instructions: Pour Ingredients Into Mixing Glass
Stir Until Properly Diluted
Strain Over Big Rock
Garnish with Flashed Orange Peel

drinks.name: PJ Killa
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Strain Over Fresh Ice
Garnish With Cinnamon Stick & Shavings
Dehydrated Lime
batch: NOTE: 2.5 oz of batch per drink

drinks.name: PJK Old Fashioned
instructions: Pour Ingredients Into Mixing Glass
Stir Until Properly Diluted
Strain Over Big Rock
Garnish With Orange Peel & Cherry

drinks.name: Rose Colored Glasses
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Double Strain Into Coupe Glass
Garnish With Dehydrated Rose Bud & Gold Dust
batch: Honey / Fig Foam Batch Coming Soon...

drinks.name: Sake Sangria
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Dirty Dump Into Wine Glass & Top with Club Soda
Garnish With Dehydrated Orange & Pineapple Frond

drinks.name: Salt & Sun
instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled.
Strain over fresh ice in a rocks glass
Garnish With Dehydrated Lime Wheel

drinks.name: Shanghai Street Fight
instructions: Pour Ingredients Into Mixing Glass
Stir Until Properly Diluted
Strain Over Big Rock
Garnish With Orange Peel

drinks.name: Shiso Lovely
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Double Strain Into Coupe Glass & Top with Club Soda
Garnish With Shiso Leaf

drinks.name: Snow On Fuji
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Double Strain Into Coupe Glass & Top with Brut
Garnish With Lychee & Mint Sprig
batch: Blend 2 Fuji Apples with Gin of Choice

drinks.name: That Yuzu, That You Do
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Strain Over Fresh Ice
Garnish With Dehydrated Lime

drinks.name: Up All Night
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Double Strain Into Martini Glass
Garnish With 3 Espresso Beans
batch: Add ingredients together and bring to a boil until thickened.

drinks.name: Zen Inferno
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Strain Over Fresh Ice
Garnish With Pineapple Frond & Dehydrated Chile De Arbol

drinks.name: Aperol Spritz
instructions: Build In Glass
Garnish with Orange Wheel

drinks.name: Cosmopolitan
instructions: Add Ingredients to Mixing Tin
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Double Strain Into Martini Glass
Garnish with Lemon Twist

drinks.name: French Martini
instructions: Add the vodka, Chambord and pineapple juice into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled.
Fine-strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

drinks.name: Hugo Spritz
instructions: Add the St. Germain and mint sprig into a wine glass
Gently muddle
Add ice, the prosecco and the soda water and stir briefly
Gently to combine
Garnish with a mint sprig and a lime wheel.

drinks.name: Lychee Martini (Classic)
instructions: Add Ingredients to Mixing Glass
Stir until well chilled and properly diluted.
Strain into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a lychee fruit.

drinks.name: Mai Tai
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Strain Over Fresh Ice
Garnish With Orange, Cherry & Mint Sprig

drinks.name: Manhattan
instructions: Add the rye whiskey, sweet vermouth, and bitters into a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled martini or coupe glass.
Garnish with a brandied cherry (or a lemon twist, if preferred).

drinks.name: Naked & Famous
instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.

drinks.name: Negroni
instructions: Pour Ingredients Into Mixing Glass
Stir Until Properly Diluted
Strain Over Fresh Ice
Garnish With Orange Or Orange Peel

drinks.name: Paper Plane
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Strain Into Nick & Nora Glass
Garnish With Orange Peel

drinks.name: Alexander
instructions: Add brandy, dark crème de cacao, and heavy cream to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously until well chilled and frothy.
Strain into a chilled coupe or martini glass.
Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg on top.

drinks.name: Amaretto Sour
instructions: Add amaretto, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white (if using) to a shaker without ice.
Dry shake for 10–15 seconds to emulsify the egg white.
Add ice and shake again until well chilled.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and a cherry.

drinks.name: Americano
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add Campari and sweet vermouth.
Top with club soda.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with an orange slice and optional lemon twist.

drinks.name: Angel Face
instructions: Add gin, apricot brandy, and apple brandy to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.

drinks.name: Aviation
instructions: Add gin, maraschino liqueur, creme de violette, and lemon juice to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake well until chilled.
Double strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a Luxardo cherry.

drinks.name: Bahama Mama
instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled.
Strain Over Fresh Ice
Garnish with Pineapple & Cherry

drinks.name: Bee's Knees
instructions: Add gin, lemon juice, orange juice and honey syrup to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a lemon or orange twist.

drinks.name: Bellini
instructions: Add peach puree to a chilled champagne flute.
Slowly top with Prosecco while gently stirring to combine.
Garnish with a peach slice, if desired.

drinks.name: Between the Sheets
instructions: Add cognac, rum, orange liqueur, and lemon juice to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist, if desired.

drinks.name: Black Russian
instructions: Add vodka and coffee liqueur to an old-fashioned glass filled with ice.
Stir gently to combine.

drinks.name: Bloody Mary
instructions: Optional: Rim the glass with celery salt.
Add vodka, tomato juice, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, horseradish (if using), salt, and pepper to a shaker filled with ice.
Roll the ingredients by pouring from one shaker to another a few times (or stir gently).
Strain into the prepared glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a celery stalk, lemon wedge, and optional pickles or olives.

drinks.name: Boulevardier
instructions: Add bourbon (or rye), Campari, and sweet vermouth to a mixing glass filled with ice.
Stir until well chilled.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass over a large ice cube or into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinks.name: Bramble
instructions: Add gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake until well chilled.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with crushed ice.
Drizzle creme de mure over the top.
Garnish with blackberries and a lemon slice.

drinks.name: Brandy Crusta
instructions: Rim a chilled coupe glass with sugar and set aside.
Add brandy, orange liqueur, maraschino liqueur, lemon juice, simple syrup, and bitters to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake until well chilled.
Line the inside of the glass with a long lemon peel.
Strain the cocktail into the prepared glass.

drinks.name: Caipirinha
instructions: Add whole lime cut into wedges and sugar to an old-fashioned glass.
Muddle well to extract juice and dissolve sugar.
Fill the glass with ice.
Pour in cachaca.
Stir well to mix and chill.
Garnish with a lime wheel or wedge.
Note:
Caipiroska – Instead of Cachaça use Vodka;
Caipirissima – Instead of Cachaça use Rum.
Caipirão – Instead of Cachaça use Licor Beirão.

drinks.name: Canchanchara
instructions: Add honey syrup and lime juice to a glass or clay cup.
Stir to combine.
Add aguardiente or Cuban rum and fill with ice.
Stir gently to chill.
Garnish with a lime wheel, if desired.

drinks.name: Cardinale
instructions: Add gin, dry vermouth, and Campari to a mixing glass filled with ice.
Stir until well chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe or Nick and Nora glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinks.name: Casino
instructions: Add Old Tom gin, maraschino liqueur, lemon juice, and orange bitters to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake well until chilled.
Double strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a Luxardo cherry and optional lemon twist.

drinks.name: Champagne Cocktail
instructions: Place a sugar cube in a chilled champagne flute.
Saturate the sugar cube with Angostura bitters.
Slowly top with chilled Champagne.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinks.name: Chartreuse Swizzle
instructions: Add all ingredients to a glass filled with crushed ice.
Swizzle (or stir vigorously) until the glass is frosty.
Top with more crushed ice if needed.
Garnish with a mint sprig and optionally a dusting of grated nutmeg.

drinks.name: Clover Club
instructions: Add gin, lemon juice, raspberry syrup, and egg white to a shaker without ice.
Dry shake for 10–15 seconds to emulsify the egg white.
Add ice and shake again until well chilled.
Double strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with raspberries, if desired.

drinks.name: Corpse Reviver #2
instructions: Rinse a chilled coupe glass with absinthe and discard the excess.
Add gin, Cointreau, Lillet Blanc, and lemon juice to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain into the prepared coupe glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinks.name: Cuba Libre
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add rum and lime juice.
Top with cola and stir gently.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinks.name: Daiquiri
instructions: Add rum, lime juice, and simple syrup to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinks.name: Daisy
instructions: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinks.name: Daisy (Original)
instructions: Add brandy, orange curaçao, lemon juice, and simple syrup to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well chilled and strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
Top with a splash of soda water.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and optional mint sprig.

drinks.name: Dark 'n' Stormy
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add ginger beer and lime juice.
Float dark rum on top.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinks.name: Don's Special Daiquiri
instructions: Add ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with passion fruit or lime wheel.

drinks.name: Espresso Martini
instructions: Add vodka, coffee liqueur, espresso, and simple syrup to a shaker with ice.
Shake vigorously until well chilled and a foam layer forms.
Strain into a chilled coupe or martini glass.
Garnish with 3 coffee beans.

drinks.name: Fernandito
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Pour Fernet-Branca over the ice.
Top with cola.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a lime wedge if desired.

drinks.name: French 75
instructions: Add the gin, lemon juice and simple syrup to a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled
Strain into a Champagne flute
Top with the Champagne or sparkling wine of choice
Garnish with a lemon twist

drinks.name: French Connection
instructions: Fill an old-fashioned glass with ice.
Add cognac and amaretto.
Stir gently to combine.

drinks.name: Garibaldi
instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add Campari.
Top with freshly squeezed orange juice (ideally whipped or aerated for a fluffy texture).
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with an orange wedge.

drinks.name: Gimlet
instructions: Add gin, lime juice, and simple syrup to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well chilled.
Double strain into a chilled coupe or martini glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinks.name: Gin Basil Smash
instructions: In a shaker, muddle a generous handful of fresh basil leaves with lemon juice and simple syrup.
Add gin and fill the shaker with ice.
Shake vigorously until well chilled.
Double strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a fresh basil leaf.

drinks.name: Gin Fizz
instructions: Add gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain into a highball or Collins glass filled with ice.
Top with club soda.
Garnish with a lemon wheel if desired.

drinks.name: Grasshopper
instructions: Add creme de menthe, creme de cacao, and cream to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously until well chilled and creamy.
Strain into a chilled coupette or cocktail glass.
Garnish with grated chocolate or a mint leaf if desired.

drinks.name: Hanky Panky
instructions: Add gin, sweet vermouth, and Fernet-Branca to a mixing glass filled with ice.
Stir until well chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail or coupette glass.
Express the oils of an orange twist over the drink and use as garnish.

drinks.name: Hemingway Special
instructions: Add rum, maraschino liqueur, lime juice, and grapefruit juice to a shaker with ice.
Shake until well chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel or cherry if desired.

drinks.name: Horse's Neck
instructions: Place a long spiral of lemon peel in a highball glass, letting one end hang over the rim.
Fill the glass with ice.
Add brandy (and bitters if using).
Top with ginger ale.
Stir gently to combine.

drinks.name: Irish Coffee
instructions: Warm an Irish coffee mug with hot water, then discard the water.
Add demerara sugar and Irish whiskey to the mug.
Fill with hot coffee and stir until the sugar dissolves.
Float lightly whipped cream on top by pouring it gently over the back of a spoon.

drinks.name: Jungle Bird
instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled.
Strain over fresh ice in a rocks glass
Garnish with a pineapple wedge

drinks.name: Lemon Drop Martini
instructions: Rim a chilled martini glass with sugar and set aside.
Add vodka, triple sec, lemon juice, and simple syrup to a shaker with ice.
Shake vigorously until well chilled.
Strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinks.name: Long Island Iced Tea
instructions: Add all ingredients into mixing tin with ice and shake.
Strain Over Fresh Ice.
Garnish with a lemon.

drinks.name: Lychee Martini
instructions: Add vodka, St-Germain, and lychee syrup to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake well until chilled.
Strain into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a lychee fruit and optional lemon twist.

drinks.name: Margarita
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Strain Over Fresh Ice
Garnish With Lime

drinks.name: Martini
instructions: Add gin and dry vermouth to a mixing glass filled with ice.
Stir until well chilled.
Strain into a chilled martini or coupe glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist or an olive.

drinks.name: Mint Julep
instructions: Gently Muddle Mint And Simple Syrup In Glass
Add Ice And Bourbon
Garnish With Mint Sprig And (Optional: Bitters)

drinks.name: Mojito
instructions: In a highball glass, muddle mint leaves with lime juice and simple syrup.
Fill the glass with ice.
Add rum and top with club soda.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a mint sprig and lime wheel.

drinks.name: Old Fashioned
instructions: Add simple syrup and bitters to an mixing glass.
Stir gently until well chilled and diluted.
Strain into a rocks glass over a large cube
Garnish with an orange twist and optional cherry.

drinks.name: Painkiller
instructions: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice and shake well.
Strain into a tiki mug or hurricane glass over crushed ice.
Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg, pineapple wedge, and orange wheel.

drinks.name: Paloma
instructions: Optional: Rim the glass with salt.
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add tequila and lime juice.
Top with grapefruit soda.
Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a grapefruit wedge and optional lime wheel.

drinks.name: Pisco Sour
instructions: Add pisco, lime juice, simple syrup and egg white into a shaker and dry-shake (without ice) vigorously.
Add ice and shake again until well chilled.
Strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass. (Alternatively, you can strain it into a rocks glass over fresh ice.)
Garnish with 3 to 5 drops of Angostura bitters. Using a straw, toothpick or similar implement, swirl the bitters into a simple design, if desired.

drinks.name: Sazerac
instructions: Rinse a chilled rocks glass with absinthe and discard excess.
In a separate mixing glass, combine rye whiskey, simple syrup, and Peychaud’s bitters with ice.
Stir until well chilled and strain into the prepared glass (no ice).
Express lemon peel over the drink and discard or drop in.

drinks.name: Sidecar
instructions: Optional: Rim the coupe glass with sugar.
Add cognac, orange liqueur, and lemon juice to a shaker filled with ice.
Shake until well chilled.
Strain into the prepared coupe glass.
Garnish with an orange twist, if desired.

drinks.name: Siesta
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Double Strain Into Coupe Glass
Garnish With Lime, Lemon or Grapefruit Wheel

drinks.name: Spicy Fifty
instructions: Add ingredients to shaker,
Shake with ice,
Double strain into chilled cocktail glass,
Garnish with red chili pepper

drinks.name: Tom Collins
instructions: Add gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup to a shaking tin with ice.
Shake well and strain into a Collins glass over fresh ice.
Top with club soda.
Garnish with a lemon wheel and cherry.

drinks.name: Vesper
instructions: Pour Into Shaker
Add Ice & Shake Vigorously
Strain into a chilled martini or coupe glass
Garnish With Lemon Twist

drinks.name: White Russian
instructions: Add vodka and coffee liqueur to an old-fashioned glass filled with ice.
Float heavy cream on top by pouring over the back of a spoon.
Stir gently before drinking, if desired.

drinks.name: White Sangria
instructions: In a wine glass filled with ice, combine white wine, orange juice, orange liqueur, and optional brandy.
Add a few slices of fruit (such as orange, lemon, and apple) and a berry or two.
Top with a splash of club soda or lemon-lime soda.
Stir gently to mix.
Garnish with a mint sprig, if desired.

items.name: Celery Salt
description: Non-alcoholic
A blend of ground celery seeds and salt
Celery salt is a savory seasoning often used in cocktails like the Bloody Mary. It imparts a subtle herbal bitterness and umami saltiness, enhancing the drink’s complexity and balance.

items.name: Guest Choice
description: A customizable rim option chosen by the guest based on their taste preferences.
Common choices include salt, sugar, or Tajín—each enhancing cocktails in different ways.
Salt highlights savory and citrus flavors, sugar balances tart ingredients, and Tajín adds a spicy, tangy kick.

items.name: Half Salt
description: A common mineral used to enhance flavor and balance sweetness or acidity in cocktails.
Often used to rim glasses, especially in drinks like Margaritas or Palomas.
Can be added as a pinch in the drink itself to deepen complexity and round out flavors.

items.name: Salt
description: A common mineral used to enhance flavor and balance sweetness or acidity in cocktails.
Often used to rim glasses, especially in drinks like Margaritas or Palomas.
Can be added as a pinch in the drink itself to deepen complexity and round out flavors.

items.name: Salt and Pepper
description: Non-alcoholic seasoning ingredients
Salt enhances flavor and is often used to rim glasses (e.g., Margaritas), while pepper adds spice and aromatic complexity
Both are used in savory cocktails like Bloody Marys or to provide balance in creative mixology
alternatives: Smoked Salt or Ground Chili for flavor variation

items.name: Sugar
description: A fundamental sweetener used to balance acidity and bitterness in cocktails.
Typically used in granulated form, but also appears in cubes for classic drinks like the Old Fashioned.
Essential for making simple syrup, a staple in many cocktails for smooth sweetness integration.

items.name: Tajin
description: A popular Mexican seasoning made from a blend of chili peppers, lime, and salt.
Adds a tangy, spicy kick and vibrant color to cocktail rims and garnishes.
Commonly used on the rim of margaritas and micheladas to enhance flavor and presentation.

items.name: Club Soda
description: Non-alcoholic
Produced by various brands (e.g., Schweppes, Canada Dry, Q Mixers)

Club soda is a carbonated water infused with minerals like sodium bicarbonate and potassium sulfate. It's used in cocktails to add fizz and volume without altering the drink’s flavor profile significantly.
alternatives: Tonic Water (note: has quinine and a bitter taste)

items.name: Coke
description: Non-alcoholic
Invented in the United States in the late 19th century
Coca-Cola is a sweet, carbonated soft drink with a distinct blend of caramel, vanilla, and spice flavors. It’s often used as a mixer in cocktails like the Rum & Coke or Whiskey & Coke.

items.name: Ginger Ale
description: A sweetened, carbonated soft drink flavored with ginger.
Commonly used as a mixer in highballs and light cocktails such as a Whiskey Ginger.

items.name: Ginger Beer
description: Non-alcoholic (typically), though some versions may contain low alcohol content
Made from ginger root, sugar, water, and often fermented for natural carbonation
Ginger Beer is a bold, spicy-sweet carbonated mixer known for its strong ginger flavor and is essential in cocktails like the Moscow Mule and Dark 'n' Stormy.
alternatives: Spicy Ginger Syrup with Club Soda

items.name: Grapefruit Soda
description: Carbonated soft drink flavored with grapefruit juice or extract
Produced by various brands worldwide

Grapefruit soda offers a balance of sweet and tart flavors, making it a refreshing mixer in cocktails like the Paloma or Greyhound. It ranges from dry and crisp to sweet and citrusy depending on the brand.
alternatives: Fresh Grapefruit Juice with Soda Water

items.name: Soda Water
description: Non-alcoholic
Commonly produced by brands like Schweppes, Canada Dry, and Q Mixers
Soda water is simply carbonated water without any added minerals or flavors. It is often used as a neutral mixer in cocktails to provide effervescence and lighten the drink’s texture.
alternatives: Tonic Water (note: adds bitter flavor due to quinine)

items.name: Sprite
description: Non-alcoholic
Produced by The Coca-Cola Company
Sprite is a clear, lemon-lime flavored soda known for its crisp, refreshing taste. It’s often used in cocktails as a light mixer to add sweetness and carbonation without overpowering other flavors.

items.name: Angostura Bitters
description: Produced in Trinidad and Tobago

Angostura Bitters is a highly concentrated herbal alcoholic preparation, made from a proprietary blend of herbs and spices. It is widely used in classic cocktails for its deep, aromatic flavor with notes of clove, cinnamon, and baking spices.
alternatives: Fee Brothers Old Fashion Aromatic Bitters

items.name: Lemon Bitters
description: Typically around 44% ABV
Produced by various artisanal and commercial bitters makers worldwide

Lemon bitters are a concentrated flavoring made by infusing alcohol with lemon peel, herbs, and spices. They add bright citrus complexity and subtle bitterness to cocktails, enhancing both aroma and flavor without overpowering the drink.
alternatives: Peychaud’s Bitters with a lemon twist

items.name: Orange Bitters
description: Typically around 40–45% ABV
Produced by several brands including Regans’, Angostura, and Fee Brothers

Orange bitters are a cocktail seasoning made by infusing alcohol with orange peel, spices, and botanicals. They provide a zesty, aromatic citrus flavor with a dry, bitter edge—commonly used in classics like the Martini or Old Fashioned to add depth and balance.

items.name: Peychaud's Bitters
description: 35% ABV
Produced in Louisiana, USA

Peychaud's Bitters is a gentian-based cocktail bitter with a bright red hue and a distinctive flavor marked by anise, cherry, and light floral notes. It is a key ingredient in the classic Sazerac cocktail.
alternatives: Regans' Orange Bitters No. 6 (for a citrus twist)

items.name: Bourbon
description: Typically 40–50% ABV (alcohol by volume).
Produced primarily in Kentucky, USA, but can be made anywhere in the U.S.
A type of American whiskey made from at least 51% corn and aged in new charred oak barrels; known for its rich, sweet, and oaky flavor with notes of vanilla and caramel.

items.name: Brandy
description: Typically 35-60% ABV
Distilled from fermented fruit juice, most commonly grapes

Brandy is a spirit produced by distilling wine or fermented fruit juice. It is aged in wooden casks, giving it a rich, smooth flavor with notes of oak, caramel, and fruit. Commonly enjoyed neat or used in cocktails like the Sidecar or Brandy Alexander.

items.name: Casamigos Reposado
description: 40% ABV
Produced in Jalisco, Mexico

Casamigos Reposado is a premium tequila aged for 7 months in American oak barrels, offering smooth, rich flavors with notes of caramel, cocoa, and soft oak, balanced by subtle hints of agave and spice.

items.name: Coconut Rum
description: A sweet, tropical-flavored rum typically infused with natural coconut extracts.
Often made with light rum as a base, offering a smooth and mildly warming finish.
Popular in tropical and tiki cocktails, adding richness and a distinct coconut aroma.

items.name: Cognac
description: Typically 40% ABV
Produced in the Cognac region of France

Cognac is a type of brandy made from white grapes, distilled twice in copper pot stills, and aged in French oak barrels. It is known for its complex flavor profile that can include notes of dried fruit, vanilla, spice, and oak.

items.name: Corazon Blanco
description: 40% ABV
Produced in Jalisco, Mexico

Corazón Blanco is an unaged tequila made from 100% blue Weber agave. It features bright, clean agave flavors with hints of citrus, pepper, and a touch of vegetal earthiness. Crisp and smooth, it's ideal for sipping or mixing in cocktails like Margaritas or Palomas.

items.name: Dark Rum
description: Typically ranges from 40–50% ABV
Produced in various Caribbean nations, including Jamaica, Barbados, and Guyana

Dark Rum is aged longer than white or gold rums, often in charred oak barrels, which imparts deep, rich flavors and a dark amber to brown color. Expect notes of molasses, caramel, vanilla, spice, and sometimes smoke. Commonly used in classic cocktails like the Dark 'n Stormy or Mai Tai.

items.name: Dos Hombres Mezcal
description: 42% ABV
Produced in San Luis del Río, Oaxaca, Mexico

Dos Hombres is an artisanal mezcal crafted from hand-selected Espadín agave. Created by actors Bryan Cranston and Aaron Paul, it offers a smooth, balanced profile with subtle smoke, notes of apple, mango, and wood, and a slightly sweet finish. It's approachable for mezcal newcomers while still satisfying for seasoned enthusiasts.

items.name: Drambuie
description: 40% ABV
Produced in Scotland

Drambuie is a golden-colored liqueur made from Scotch whisky, heather honey, herbs, and spices. It has a rich, smooth flavor with notes of honeyed sweetness, warm spices, and a hint of peat, making it a classic ingredient in cocktails like the Rusty Nail.

items.name: Gin
description: Typically 37.5%–47% ABV
Produced globally, with notable styles from the UK, Netherlands, and USA

Gin is a distilled spirit flavored predominantly with juniper berries, often accompanied by botanicals like coriander, citrus peel, angelica root, and orris root. It ranges in style from dry to floral to citrus-forward, and forms the base of many classic cocktails like the Martini and Negroni.

items.name: Vodka or Gin
description: Gin: Typically 37.5%–47% ABV | Vodka: Typically 35%–50% ABV
Gin is produced globally, notably in the UK, Netherlands, and USA. Vodka is produced worldwide, with key origins in Russia, Poland, and Sweden.

Gin is a juniper-forward spirit infused with botanicals like coriander, citrus peel, and angelica root, ranging from dry to floral. Vodka is a neutral grain or potato-based spirit known for its purity and versatility in cocktails.

items.name: Irish Whiskey
description: Typically triple-distilled and aged for at least three years in wooden casks.
Known for its smooth, light, and slightly sweet flavor profile with notes of vanilla, honey, and toasted wood.
Produced exclusively in Ireland under strict regulations ensuring quality and authenticity.

items.name: Jalapeno Infused Tequila
description: A tequila infusion made by steeping fresh jalapeño slices in blanco tequila until the desired heat level is reached.
Bright, vegetal, and spicy, with natural heat from jalapeño oils balanced by the clean character of blanco tequila.
Commonly used in spicy margaritas, palomas, and other cocktails requiring a controlled kick of heat.
alternatives: Jalapeño Simple Syrup (for a milder spice)

items.name: Jamaican Gold Rum
description: A medium-bodied rum with a rich golden color from aging in oak barrels
Known for bold, funky esters and tropical fruit notes characteristic of Jamaican distillation methods
Adds depth and complexity to tiki cocktails, punches, and classic rum drinks

items.name: Los Vecinos Mezcal
description: 45% ABV (alcohol by volume).
Produced in Oaxaca, Mexico by master distillers using traditional methods.
An artisanal mezcal made from 100% Espadín agave; known for its earthy, smoky flavor with hints of citrus and spice.

items.name: Mezcal
description: Typically 40%–55% ABV
Produced primarily in Oaxaca, Mexico, though other states like Durango and Guerrero also contribute

Mezcal is a traditional Mexican spirit distilled from agave, often roasted in underground pits, giving it a distinctive smoky flavor. It encompasses a wide range of agave species, regions, and artisanal production techniques, making it a diverse and complex category.

items.name: Plantation Dark Rum
description: 40% ABV
Produced in the Caribbean (primarily Barbados and Jamaica), blended and finished in France by Maison Ferrand

Plantation Dark Rum is a richly flavored rum known for its notes of ripe banana, tropical fruits, vanilla, and spice. Aged in both tropical and continental climates, it offers depth and complexity from double aging in bourbon and cognac casks.

items.name: Rittenhouse Rye
description: 50% ABV (100 Proof)
Produced in Kentucky, USA by Heaven Hill Distillery

Rittenhouse Rye is a bold, bonded straight rye whiskey known for its spicy, dry profile with notes of cocoa, citrus peel, and baking spice. It's a favorite among bartenders for classic cocktails like the Manhattan or Old Fashioned.

items.name: Rivi Gin
description: 42% ABV
Produced in Devon, England
Rivi Gin is a modern British gin made with a blend of traditional botanicals and locally sourced Devon herbs, offering a smooth and floral profile with notes of citrus, juniper, and wildflowers.

items.name: Rum
description: Typically ranges from 35% to 50% ABV
Produced globally, especially in the Caribbean, Central and South America, and parts of Asia

Rum is a distilled spirit made from sugarcane byproducts such as molasses or directly from sugarcane juice. It varies in style from light and crisp white rums to rich, aged dark rums, and is a cornerstone of tropical and tiki-style cocktails.

items.name: Rye Whiskey
description: Typically 40% to 50% ABV
Primarily produced in the United States and Canada

Rye whiskey is a spicy, bold spirit distilled from a mash bill containing at least 51% rye grain. Known for its peppery, dry character, it's a staple in classic cocktails like the Manhattan and Old Fashioned. American rye tends to be more robust, while Canadian rye is often smoother and more blended.

items.name: Sazerac Rye
description: 45% ABV (90 Proof)
Produced by Buffalo Trace Distillery in Frankfort, Kentucky.
Sazerac Rye is a classic American rye whiskey with bold notes of clove, vanilla, anise, and pepper, finishing smooth with a touch of sweetness. It’s famously used in the Sazerac cocktail.

items.name: St. George Citrus
description: 40% ABV
Distilled in Alameda, California, USA

This vodka is infused with Valencia oranges, Seville oranges, and bergamot, offering a bright, zesty citrus profile with a clean finish. It’s made from real fruit with no added flavorings or sweeteners, making it ideal for light, citrus-forward cocktails.

items.name: St. George Terroir
description: 45% ABV
Distilled in Alameda, California, USA

This unique gin captures the essence of California’s wilderness with botanicals like Douglas fir, California bay laurel, and coastal sage. It delivers a bold, earthy aroma and a resinous, forest-like flavor that makes it stand out in classic gin cocktails or sipped neat.

items.name: Blanco Tequila
description: Typically around 38–40% ABV
Produced primarily in Jalisco, Mexico

Blanco Tequila, also known as silver or white tequila, is unaged and bottled shortly after distillation. It showcases the purest expression of blue Weber agave, often with notes of pepper, citrus, and earthy minerals. Ideal for cocktails like Margaritas or Tequila Sours.

items.name: Vodka
description: Typically 40% ABV
Produced worldwide, with notable producers in Russia, Poland, Sweden, and the USA

Vodka is a clear, neutral spirit known for its clean taste and versatility in cocktails. Traditionally distilled from grains or potatoes, it serves as a base for countless drinks and is appreciated for its smoothness and subtle character.

items.name: Wheatley Vodka
description: 41% ABV
Produced in Frankfort, Kentucky, USA

Crafted at Buffalo Trace Distillery, Wheatley Vodka is a small-batch vodka made with wheat and distilled ten times for exceptional smoothness. It offers a crisp, clean profile with subtle hints of vanilla and a soft, rounded mouthfeel.

items.name: Whiskey
description: Typically 40% ABV and higher
Produced globally, with major styles from the U.S., Scotland, Ireland, Canada, and Japan

Whiskey is a distilled spirit made from fermented grain mash, aged in wooden barrels. It encompasses a variety of styles including bourbon, rye, Scotch, and Irish whiskey, each with distinct characteristics based on region, ingredients, and aging process.

items.name: Amaretto
description: Originates from Italy, notably Saronno

Amaretto is a sweet Italian liqueur made from almonds or apricot pits, offering a distinct nutty flavor with hints of vanilla and spice. It is commonly used in cocktails like the Amaretto Sour or enjoyed on its own.

items.name: Aperol
description: 11% ABV
Produced in Padua, Italy

Aperol is a vibrant Italian apéritif made from a secret blend of herbs and roots, including rhubarb and gentian. It’s known for its bright orange color and bittersweet, citrus-forward flavor, making it a key ingredient in the iconic Aperol Spritz.

items.name: Aqua Perfecta Basil Brandy
description: 40% ABV
Produced by St. George Spirits in Alameda, California

Aqua Perfecta Basil Brandy is a rare, herbaceous brandy distilled from fresh basil and fruit, capturing the intense aroma and flavor of just-picked basil. It's delicate, aromatic, and ideal for creative cocktails or sipping neat.

items.name: Campari
description: 24% ABV
Produced in Italy

Campari is a classic Italian apéritif known for its distinctive red color and bold, bittersweet flavor. Created in 1860, it's made from an infusion of herbs, aromatic plants, and fruit, though the exact recipe remains a closely guarded secret. Its complex profile of bitter orange, cherry, rhubarb, and spices makes it a key ingredient in iconic cocktails like the Negroni, Americano, and Boulevardier.

items.name: Chambord
description: Produced in the Loire Valley, France

Chambord is a luxurious French black raspberry liqueur crafted with a blend of raspberries, blackberries, Madagascan vanilla, Moroccan citrus peel, honey, and cognac. Its rich, dark berry flavor with subtle notes of spice and vanilla makes it a versatile ingredient in cocktails or a decadent addition to desserts.

items.name: Chinola Passion Fruit
description: 21% ABV
Produced in the Dominican Republic

Chinola is a handcrafted liqueur made from real passion fruit juice blended with distilled spirits. It offers a bright, tangy, and slightly sweet flavor profile that highlights the tropical essence of fresh passion fruit, making it a standout addition to cocktails like spritzes, sours, and tropical riffs.
alternatives: Homemade passion fruit syrup with vodka or rum

items.name: Coffee Liqueur
description: Typically around 20–30% ABV
Origin varies by brand (e.g., Mexico for Kahlúa, Italy for Borghetti)
Coffee liqueur is a sweet, rich spirit made by combining coffee with a base liquor (usually rum or vodka) and sugar. It delivers deep coffee flavor with subtle chocolate and vanilla notes.
alternatives: Mr. Black Cold Brew Coffee Liqueur

items.name: Cointreau
description: 40% ABV
Produced in Angers, France

Cointreau is a premium French triple sec made from a blend of sweet and bitter orange peels. Known for its crystal-clear appearance and vibrant, balanced citrus flavor, it is a staple in classic cocktails like the Margarita, Cosmopolitan, and Sidecar.

items.name: Domaine De Canton
description: 28% ABV
Produced in Jarnac, France

Domaine de Canton is a premium French ginger liqueur crafted from fresh baby ginger, Grand Champagne VSOP Cognac, Tahitian vanilla, and orange blossom honey from Provence. It offers a harmonious balance of spicy ginger warmth, subtle sweetness, and a smooth cognac finish, making it a versatile addition to both classic and contemporary cocktails.

items.name: Dry Curacao
description: Typically 30–40% ABV
Often produced in France, the Netherlands, or the Caribbean

Dry Curaçao is a traditional orange liqueur made from bitter orange peels, brandy or neutral spirit, and various spices. Known for its drier, more complex flavor compared to triple sec, it brings notes of citrus zest, spice, and a mild sweetness, making it ideal for classic cocktails like the Mai Tai or Sidecar.

items.name: Fernet-Branca
description: 39% ABV
Produced in Milan, Italy

Fernet-Branca is a bold and bitter Italian amaro made with a secret blend of 27 herbs, roots, and spices including myrrh, rhubarb, chamomile, and saffron. Known for its intense medicinal flavor and high alcohol content, it is often consumed as a digestif or used in cocktails like the Toronto or the Hanky Panky.

items.name: Gran Gala
description: An Italian orange liqueur made from brandy and natural orange essence.
It has a rich, smooth flavor with notes of sweet orange, vanilla, and caramel.
Often used as a substitute for Grand Marnier in cocktails, adding depth and sweetness.

items.name: Grand Marnier
description: 40% ABV
Produced in France

Grand Marnier is a premium French liqueur made from a blend of Cognac and bitter orange essence. It offers a rich, smooth flavor with notes of orange peel, oak, vanilla, and spices. Often used in classic cocktails like the Margarita, Sidecar, or B-52, it's also enjoyed neat or in desserts.

items.name: Green Chartreuse
description: 55% ABV
Produced by Carthusian monks in Voiron, France

Green Chartreuse is a vibrant herbal liqueur made from a secret blend of 130 herbs and botanicals. It has a bold, complex flavor with notes of mint, anise, citrus, and spices, and a vivid green color derived naturally from its ingredients.

items.name: Luxardo Cherry Liqueur
description: 32% ABV
Produced in Torreglia, Italy

Luxardo Cherry Liqueur, also known as Sangue Morlacco, is a deep red liqueur made from marasca cherries. It offers rich, sweet, and slightly tart cherry flavors with a velvety texture. Often used in classic cocktails like the Singapore Sling or the Blood and Sand, it can also be sipped neat or used in desserts.

items.name: Montenegro
description: 23% ABV
Produced in Bologna, Italy

Amaro Montenegro is a classic Italian herbal liqueur made from a secret blend of 40 botanicals, including spices, roots, and citrus peels. It has a bittersweet, complex flavor profile with notes of orange peel, vanilla, rose, and subtle spice, making it popular for sipping or mixing in cocktails like the Monte & Mezcal or Paper Plane.

items.name: Orange Curacao
description: Typically 30–40% ABV
Originated from the island of Curaçao, often produced in the Caribbean or France

Orange Curaçao is a sweet, orange-flavored liqueur made from the dried peels of bitter and sweet oranges. It has a rich, slightly bitter citrus profile and is commonly used in classic cocktails like the Mai Tai and Blue Lagoon.

items.name: Orange Liqueur
description: Typically 30–40% ABV
Produced globally, with well-known varieties from France, the Caribbean, and the Netherlands

Orange liqueur is a category of sweetened alcoholic beverages flavored with orange peel and zest. It includes a range of styles from dry to sweet, and is often used to add citrus brightness and complexity to cocktails such as the Margarita, Sidecar, and Cosmopolitan.

items.name: St. Germain
description: 20% ABV
Produced in France

St-Germain is an artisanal French liqueur crafted from fresh elderflower blossoms handpicked in the Alps. It offers a delicately sweet and floral profile with notes of pear, lychee, and citrus, making it a versatile addition to sparkling wine, gin, vodka, and tequila-based cocktails.
alternatives: Homemade elderflower cordial (as a non-alcoholic substitute)

items.name: Triple Sec
description: Typically 15–40% ABV depending on the brand
Originated in France
Triple Sec is a clear, orange-flavored liqueur made from dried orange peels. It adds citrus brightness and sweetness to cocktails like the Margarita, Cosmopolitan, and Sidecar.

items.name: Yellow Chartreuse
description: 40% ABV
Produced in Voiron, France by Carthusian monks

Yellow Chartreuse is a French herbal liqueur made from a secret blend of 130 plants, flowers, and herbs. It is milder and sweeter than Green Chartreuse, with notes of honey, saffron, anise, and citrus, and features a distinctive golden-yellow color derived from saffron.

items.name: Dry Vermouth
description: Typically 16–18% ABV
Originated in France and Italy

Dry Vermouth is a fortified wine aromatized with herbs and botanicals. It is crisp, slightly bitter, and herbal, making it a staple in classic cocktails like the Martini and the Manhattan (alongside sweet vermouth).

items.name: Lillet Blanc
description: 17% ABV
Produced in Podensac, France

Lillet Blanc is a French aromatized wine made from Bordeaux grapes blended with citrus liqueurs and quinine. It has a floral and honeyed aroma with flavors of orange peel, white fruit, and gentle herbal bitterness, often used in aperitif cocktails like the Vesper or served over ice.

items.name: Living Jewel Sake
description: Brewed in Japan by Yaegaki Corporation

Living Jewel Sake is a Junmai sake made with premium rice and soft water, resulting in a well-balanced, smooth, and slightly dry profile. It features delicate notes of melon, pear, and rice with a clean finish, making it versatile for pairing with light dishes or enjoying chilled.

items.name: Sweet Vermouth
description: Typically 15–18% ABV
Originated in Italy; now produced globally

Sweet vermouth is a fortified wine aromatized with herbs, roots, and spices. It has a rich, slightly bitter-sweet flavor with notes of vanilla, caramel, spices, and dried fruit. Commonly used in classic cocktails like the Manhattan and Negroni.

items.name: White Wine
description: Typically 11–14% ABV
Produced globally in wine regions such as France, Italy, the U.S., and New Zealand

White wine is made from green or yellow grapes (or red grapes with skins removed before fermentation). It ranges in flavor from dry and crisp to sweet and fruity, and is often used in cocktails, spritzes, or for deglazing and flavoring in culinary applications.

items.name: Albert Bichot Brut
description: 12% ABV
Produced in Burgundy, France

Albert Bichot Brut is a sparkling wine made in the traditional method, offering crisp acidity and fine bubbles with notes of green apple, citrus, white flowers, and a touch of brioche. A refined and elegant choice for celebratory occasions or cocktail bases.

items.name: Champagne
description: Typically 12–12.5% ABV
Produced in the Champagne region of France

Champagne is a sparkling wine made using the traditional method (Méthode Champenoise), known for its fine bubbles, bright acidity, and complex flavors ranging from citrus and green apple to brioche, almond, and mineral notes. It is often used in celebratory toasts and elegant cocktails.

items.name: Butterfly Pea Flower Syrup
description: A vibrant indigo syrup made from butterfly pea flowers.
Changes color to pink or purple when mixed with acidic ingredients.
Adds light floral notes and dramatic visual effect to cocktails.

items.name: Honey Syrup
description: Non-alcoholic
Made by diluting honey with water, usually in a 1:1 or 2:1 ratio
Honey syrup is a versatile sweetener used in cocktails to provide the rich, floral sweetness of honey in a more pourable, mixable form. It blends well in both hot and cold drinks.

items.name: Lychee Syrup
description: Non-alcoholic
Typically produced from lychee fruit concentrate or purée blended with sugar and water

Lychee syrup is a sweet, fragrant syrup made from the tropical lychee fruit. It has a floral, slightly tart flavor with notes of rose and pear, making it an excellent addition to exotic or aromatic cocktails and mocktails.

items.name: Orgeat
description: Non-alcoholic
Originally from France, now used globally

Orgeat is a sweet almond syrup flavored with a hint of orange flower or rose water. It has a creamy, nutty profile and is essential in classic cocktails like the Mai Tai, lending richness and a floral backbone to drinks.
alternatives: Homemade orgeat (DIY versions with varying nut and floral intensity)

items.name: Simple Syrup
description: Non-alcoholic sweetener
Made by dissolving sugar in water, typically at a 1:1 or 2:1 ratio

Simple syrup is a staple cocktail ingredient that provides sweetness without the grittiness of granulated sugar. It’s used to balance flavors and enhance other ingredients in both classic and modern drinks.

items.name: Lemon Juice
description: Non-alcoholic
Typically sourced from fresh lemons or bottled with minimal additives
Lemon juice adds bright acidity and a refreshing tartness to cocktails. It balances sweetness, enhances flavors, and is a key ingredient in classics like the Whiskey Sour and Tom Collins.

items.name: Lime Juice
description: Highly acidic citrus juice, typically around 6-8% acidity
Sourced from Persian or Key limes, grown in tropical and subtropical regions
Lime juice is a staple in cocktail making, prized for its tart brightness. It balances sweetness, enhances flavors, and adds a refreshing zing to drinks like margaritas, mojitos, and gimlets.
alternatives: Citric Acid Solution (when fresh citrus is unavailable)

items.name: Orange Juice
description: Non-alcoholic
Made by extracting juice from fresh oranges, commonly from Valencia or Navel varieties
Orange juice is a bright, citrusy ingredient that brings sweetness, acidity, and a vibrant freshness to cocktails. It’s commonly used in drinks like the Screwdriver and Mimosa.

items.name: Pineapple Juice
description: Tropical fruit juice made from pressed or blended pineapple
Offers a sweet and tangy flavor with a bright acidity
Commonly used in tiki and tropical cocktails to add body, sweetness, and a fruity aroma

items.name: Pomegranate Juice
description: Non-alcoholic
Typically made from fresh-pressed pomegranate seeds or available as bottled juice

Pomegranate juice offers a deep ruby color, sweet-tart flavor, and antioxidant richness. It adds complexity and vibrant color to cocktails and mocktails, pairing well with spirits like vodka, gin, and rum.

items.name: Basil
description: A fragrant green herb with a sweet, slightly peppery flavor and hints of anise and clove.
Used in cocktails for fresh, aromatic notes and as a vibrant garnish.

items.name: Coffee
description: A brewed beverage made from roasted coffee beans, typically served hot.
Known for its rich aroma, bold flavor, and stimulating caffeine content.
Commonly used as a base for coffee cocktails like the Irish Coffee or Espresso Martini.

items.name: Espresso
description: A concentrated coffee brewed by forcing hot water through finely-ground coffee beans.
Known for its rich flavor, velvety body, and crema layer.

items.name: Hot Coffee
description: A brewed beverage made from roasted coffee beans, typically served hot.
Known for its rich aroma, bold flavor, and stimulating caffeine content.
Commonly used as a base for coffee cocktails like the Irish Coffee or Espresso Martini.

items.name: Lime
description: Citrus fruit known for its tart, acidic juice and fragrant zest
Commonly used in cocktails for balance and brightness
Fresh lime juice is preferred for its sharp flavor; also used as a garnish or rim enhancer
alternatives: Bottled lime juice (less preferred due to flavor loss)

items.name: Barsmith Dirty Martini
description: A pre-made dirty martini mix crafted from premium olive brine and filtered water.
Designed to create a consistent, balanced dirty martini with the ideal level of salinity.
Offers a clean, savory olive flavor without the bitterness sometimes found in raw brines.

items.name: Egg White
description: Used in cocktails to add a smooth, silky texture and a frothy head
Common in classic drinks like the Whiskey Sour and Pisco Sour
Flavor is neutral; it's primarily used for texture and visual appeal

items.name: Heavy Cream
description: Contains about 36–40% milk fat
Widely produced in dairy farms across the world
Heavy cream is a rich, thick cream commonly used in cocktails for texture and body. It adds a smooth, velvety mouthfeel and helps balance stronger or more bitter ingredients.

items.name: Lightly Whipped Cream
description: Contains about 36–40% milk fat
Widely produced in dairy farms across the world
Heavy cream is a rich, thick cream commonly used in cocktails for texture and body. It adds a smooth, velvety mouthfeel and helps balance stronger or more bitter ingredients.

items.name: Absinthe
description: A high-proof spirit flavored with anise, fennel, and wormwood
Known for its intense herbal, licorice-like flavor and green hue
Traditionally used in small quantities to rinse or mist glassware in cocktails like the Sazerac or Corpse Reviver No. 2

items.name: Aguardiente
description: Traditionally produced in countries like Colombia, Ecuador, and Spain
Aguardiente is a strong anise-flavored spirit derived from sugarcane, commonly enjoyed as a shot or in cocktails across Latin American cultures.

items.name: Apricot Brandy
description: Typically 20–30% ABV
Produced by infusing brandy with apricot flavor or distilling fermented apricot juice
Apricot Brandy is a sweet, fruit-forward liqueur known for its rich apricot aroma and flavor. It’s commonly used in both classic and tropical-style cocktails to add warmth and fruity complexity.

items.name: Blackberry Liqueur
description: Typically 15–25% ABV (varies by brand and recipe)
A sweet, dark purple liqueur made by infusing blackberries into a neutral spirit, often with added sugar
Used in cocktails for its fruity, tart flavor—often interchangeable with Crème de Mûre
alternatives: Homemade blackberry syrup with a touch of vodka or rum

items.name: Blackstrap Rum
description: Typically around 40% ABV
Produced in various regions including the Caribbean and the U.S.

Blackstrap Rum is a dark, rich molasses-forward rum made from the final molasses byproduct of sugar refining. It offers deep flavors of burnt caramel, licorice, toffee, and spice, making it ideal for tiki drinks and bold cocktails where its intense profile can shine.

items.name: Butterfly Pea Gin
description: A floral-infused variation of Rivi Gin featuring butterfly pea flower and honeysuckle.
Naturally colored with butterfly pea flower, which gives the gin a vibrant indigo hue that can change color with pH (e.g., when mixed with citrus).
Offers a delicate balance of floral notes and subtle sweetness, making it ideal for visually striking cocktails.

items.name: Cachaca
description: Typically 38–48% ABV
A Brazilian spirit made from fermented sugarcane juice, similar to rum but with a distinct grassy, earthy flavor
Used primarily in the Caipirinha cocktail, it's a key component of Brazilian mixology and varies from industrial to artisanal expressions
alternatives: Pisco (in some cocktails with citrus-forward profiles)

items.name: Caffe Borghetti Espresso
description: 25% ABV
Produced in Italy

Caffè Borghetti is an authentic Italian coffee liqueur crafted from real espresso made with Arabica and Robusta beans. Based on a recipe dating back to 1860, it offers a rich, intense aroma and a sweet, enveloping taste with notes of freshly brewed coffee, dark chocolate, and hints of vanilla. Its smooth and velvety texture makes it ideal for sipping neat, over ice, or as a key ingredient in coffee-based cocktails.
alternatives: Mr Black Cold Brew Coffee Liqueur

items.name: Calvados
description: Typically 40% ABV
Produced in the Normandy region of France

Calvados is a French apple brandy made by distilling cider. It offers a complex flavor profile with notes of baked apple, spice, and oak, and is often enjoyed neat or used in classic cocktails like the Corpse Reviver No.1.

items.name: Cream of Coconut
description: Non-alcoholic
Produced by various brands including Coco López and Real Gourmet
Cream of Coconut is a sweetened coconut milk product used in tropical and tiki cocktails. It has a rich, creamy texture and intense coconut flavor, commonly found in drinks like the Piña Colada.

items.name: Creme de Cacao (White)
description: A clear, sweet liqueur with flavors of chocolate and vanilla.
Used in dessert cocktails and classics like the Alexander.

items.name: Creme De Menthe (Green)
description: A sweet, mint-flavored liqueur with a vibrant green color.
Often used in dessert cocktails and classics like the Grasshopper.

items.name: Creme de Violette
description: Typically 20% ABV
Originated in France

Creme de Violette is a floral liqueur made from violet flowers. It has a deep purple color and offers a sweet, perfumed flavor. Most famously used in the classic Aviation cocktail, it adds both color and a delicate floral note.

items.name: Cuban Rum
description: Typically 35–40% ABV
Produced in Cuba, under strict government regulations and traditional methods
Cuban Rum is known for its smooth, light-bodied profile with notes of molasses, vanilla, and subtle oak, making it ideal for classic cocktails like the Mojito and Daiquiri.

items.name: Dark Creme de Cacao
description: Sweet chocolate-flavored liqueur
Traditionally made from cocoa beans and vanilla

Dark Creme de Cacao is a rich, sweet liqueur used in classic and dessert-style cocktails. It has a deeper chocolate flavor and darker color compared to the white variety, making it ideal for drinks where chocolate notes are prominent.

items.name: Demerara Sugar
description: A type of raw cane sugar with large, golden-brown crystals and a subtle molasses flavor.
It is less refined than white sugar, retaining more of its natural minerals and caramel notes.
Commonly used in cocktails and baking for added depth and texture.

items.name: Demerara Syrup
description: Rich, dark simple syrup made from Demerara sugar.
Known for its deep caramel and molasses flavor that adds body and complexity to cocktails.
Commonly used in tropical and spirit-forward drinks like the Old Fashioned or Mai Tai.

items.name: Falernum
description: A sweet Caribbean syrup or liqueur flavored with lime, almond, ginger, and cloves
Available in both alcoholic and non-alcoholic versions
Commonly used in tiki and tropical cocktails to add depth, spice, and citrus complexity

items.name: Grenadine
description: Non-alcoholic
Traditionally made from pomegranate juice, sugar, and water (though many commercial versions use artificial flavors)

Grenadine is a rich, ruby-red syrup known for its sweet and slightly tart profile. It’s used to add color, sweetness, and a fruity depth to classic cocktails like the Tequila Sunrise and Shirley Temple.

items.name: Horseradish
description: Non-alcoholic condiment
A pungent root commonly used to add heat and sharpness to savory cocktails
Most famously used in Bloody Marys to enhance spiciness and depth of flavor

items.name: Hot Sauce
description: Non-alcoholic condiment
Made from chili peppers, vinegar, and salt, with regional variations across the globe
Hot sauce adds heat, tang, and complexity to cocktails like the Bloody Mary or Michelada, enhancing flavor and intensity.
alternatives: Tabasco or other regional pepper sauces

items.name: House Made Lemonade
description: Non-alcoholic
Made in-house using fresh lemons, water, and sugar
House Made Lemonade is a fresh, tart, and slightly sweet citrus mixer commonly used in cocktails for brightness or served on its own as a refreshing beverage.
alternatives: Fresh Lemon Juice with Simple Syrup

items.name: My Oh Mai Tai Batch
description: ABV varies depending on the rum base and dilution
Typically prepared in-house

A modern twist on the classic Mai Tai, this clarified batch blends rum, lime, orgeat, and orange liqueur. The clarification process removes solids for a crystal-clear appearance while retaining the drink’s tropical depth, nutty richness, and citrus brightness.

items.name: Old Tom Gin
description: Typically 40–45% ABV
Historically produced in England, now crafted by various distillers worldwide

Old Tom Gin is a slightly sweeter and fuller-bodied style of gin, bridging the gap between Dutch Genever and London Dry. It features botanicals similar to dry gin but with a softer, rounder profile, making it ideal for classic cocktails like the Tom Collins and Martinez.

items.name: Passion Fruit Syrup
description: A sweet and tangy syrup made from passion fruit pulp and sugar
Offers vibrant tropical aromas with tart, citrusy notes
Commonly used in tiki cocktails, lemonades, and exotic punches

items.name: Pisco
description: Typically 38–48% ABV
Produced in Peru and Chile

Pisco is a clear or slightly amber grape brandy made by distilling fermented grape juice into a high-proof spirit without aging in wood. It has floral, fruity, and earthy notes and is the base spirit in cocktails like the Pisco Sour and Chilcano.

items.name: Prosecco
description: Produced primarily in the Veneto and Friuli Venezia Giulia regions of Italy

Prosecco is a sparkling white wine made primarily from the Glera grape. It’s known for its light, crisp, and fruity character with notes of green apple, pear, and white flowers. It is typically less dry and more fruit-forward than Champagne, making it a popular choice for spritzes and celebratory cocktails.

items.name: Raspberry Syrup
description: A sweet, fruit-based syrup made from raspberries, sugar, and water
Adds a tart berry flavor and vibrant red color to cocktails
Often used in drinks like Clover Club or for custom raspberry infusions

items.name: Redemption Rye
description: 42%–46% ABV depending on the expression
Distilled in Indiana and bottled in Kentucky, USA

Redemption Whiskey is a high-rye bourbon or rye whiskey (depending on the expression) known for its bold spice, smooth vanilla undertones, and classic American whiskey character. It’s crafted to highlight the rye content and is popular in both sipping and classic cocktails like the Old Fashioned or Manhattan.

items.name: Rittenhouse Rye
description: 50% ABV (100 Proof)
Produced in Kentucky, USA by Heaven Hill Distillery

Rittenhouse Rye is a bold, bonded straight rye whiskey known for its spicy, dry profile with notes of cocoa, citrus peel, and baking spice. It's a favorite among bartenders for classic cocktails like the Manhattan or Old Fashioned.

items.name: Rose Bud Infused Vodka
description: Typically 35–40% ABV, depending on base vodka
Homemade or craft-infused, often using premium neutral vodka as a base

Rose Bud Infused Vodka features a delicate floral aroma and subtle sweetness, created by steeping dried rose buds in vodka. It's ideal for elegant cocktails, adding a romantic, botanical note to spritzes, fizzes, or martinis.

items.name: St. George Botanivore
description: 45% ABV
Crafted in Alameda, California, USA

St. George Botanivore is a vibrant American gin distilled with 19 botanicals, including bay laurel, coriander, and dill seed. It offers a fresh, herbaceous flavor profile with floral and citrus notes, making it highly versatile for both classic and modern cocktails.

items.name: Sugar Cube
description: Solid form of sugar, typically made from white granulated sugar pressed into cube shapes
Used for precise sugar measurement and slow dissolution in cocktails
Common in classic drinks like the Old Fashioned or Champagne Cocktail, often muddled with bitters or liquids to create a base

items.name: Tomato Juice
description: Non-alcoholic
Made from fresh, ripe tomatoes—sometimes with added salt, spices, or citric acid
Tomato juice is a savory mixer known for its use in cocktails like the Bloody Mary. It adds body, acidity, and umami richness, balancing bold spirits and spices.

items.name: White Peach Puree
description: Non-alcoholic
Made from ripe white peaches blended into a smooth, thick purée
White peach puree adds a delicate, sweet, and slightly floral fruitiness to cocktails. It is often used in Bellinis and other fruit-forward drinks for its soft flavor and natural texture.

items.name: Worcestershire Sauce
description: Non-alcoholic condiment
Originally from England, made with vinegar, molasses, anchovies, tamarind, garlic, and various seasonings
Worcestershire sauce is a savory, umami-rich ingredient commonly used to enhance depth in cocktails like the Bloody Mary, as well as in marinades and sauces.
alternatives: Soy Sauce (with a dash of vinegar and sugar)
